sen.j: 令制国一覧 > 畿内 > 山城国 > 乙訓郡
sen.e: List of provinces administered in the past by the ryo-sei, or administrative codes (令制国)/Kinai (five provinces in the immediate vicinity of Kyoto)/Yamashiro Province/Otokuni-gun
List of provinces administered in the past by the ryo-sei, or administrative codes (令制国)/Kinai (five provinces in the immediate vicinity of Kyoto)/Yamashiro Province/Otokuni-gun
List of provinces administered in the past by the ryo-sei, or administrative codes (令制国)/Kinai (five provinces in the immediate vicinity of Kyoto)/Yamashiro Province/Otokuni-gun

sen.j: 乙訓郡（おとくにぐん、おとくにのこおり）は、京都府・山城国の郡である。
sen.e: Otokuni-gun was a district in Yamashiro Province, and is presently a district in Kyoto Prefecture.
Otokuni-gun was a district in Yamashiro Province, and is presently a district in Kyoto Prefecture.
Otokuni-gun was a district in Yamashiro Province, and is presently a district in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在は以下の1町のみで構成されている。
sen.e: Otokuni-gun is comprised of only the following town:
Otokuni-gun is comprised of only the following town:
Otokuni-gun is comprised of only the following town:

sen.j: 大山崎町（おおやまざきちょう）
sen.e: Oyamazaki-cho
Oyamazaki-cho
Oyamazaki-cho

sen.j: 現在の長岡京市と向日市の全域、京都市西京区および南区 (京都市)、伏見区の一部もかつては乙訓郡に属していた。
sen.e: Otokuni-gun used to include the entire areas of the present-day Nagaokakyo City and Muko City as well as the present-day Nishikyo and Minami Wards, Kyoto City and a portion of the present-day Fushimi Ward.

Otokuni-gun used to include the entire region which includes present-day Nagaokakyo City and Muko City as well as the present-day Nishikyo and Minami Wards, Kyoto City and a portion of the present-day Fushimi Ward.

Otokuni-gun used to include the entire region which includes present-day Nagaokakyo City and Muko City as well as the present-day Nishikyo and Minami Wards, Kyoto City and a portion of the present-day Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: 乙訓は昔この地方が「弟国」と呼ばれていたのが語源とされる。
sen.e: The name "Otokuni-gun" is believed to have originated from the fact that the region had been called 'Otokuni' (literally, "younger brother country").
The name "Otokuni-gun" is believed to have originated from the fact that the region had been called 'Otokuni' (literally, "younger brother country").
The name "Otokuni-gun" is believed to have originated from the fact that the region had been called 'Otokuni' (literally, "younger brother country").

sen.j: なお、「兄国」は葛野郡（現在の京都市西部）だと言われている。
sen.e: Additionarlly, "Ekuni' (literally, "older brother country") is said to have been Kadono-gun (the present-day west part of Kyoto City).
Additionally, "Ekuni' (literally, "older brother country") is said to have been Kadono-gun (the present-day west part of Kyoto City).
Additionally, "Ekuni' (literally, "older brother country") is said to have been Kadono-gun (the present-day west part of Kyoto City).

sen.j: 長岡京や山城国国府などが置かれた。
sen.e: Nagaoka-kyo (the capital) and the ancient provincial office of Yamashiro Province were established in Otokuni-gun.
Nagaoka-kyo (the capital) and the ancient provincial office of Yamashiro Province were established in Otokuni-gun.
Nagaoka-kyo (the capital) and the ancient provincial office of Yamashiro Province were established in Otokuni-gun.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）4月10日 - 郡区町村編制法に基づき向日町に乙訓郡役所を設置。
sen.e: April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), Otokuni-gun district office was established in Muko-machi.
April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), Otokuni-gun district office was established in Muko-machi.
April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), Otokuni-gun district office was established in Muko-machi.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 - 町村制施行に伴い、乙訓郡に向日町と乙訓村・新神足村・海印寺村・淀村・久我村・羽束師村・大枝村・大原野村・久世村・大山崎村が成立する。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Muko-machi, Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura, Kaiinji-mura, Yodo-mura, Koga-mura, Hazukashi-mura, Oe-mura, Oharano-mura, Kuze-mura and Oyamazaki-mura were established in Otokuni-gun.

April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Muko-machi, Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura, Kaiinji-mura, Yodo-mura, Koga-mura, Hazukashi-mura, Oe-mura, Oharano-mura, Kuze-mura and Oyamazaki-mura were established in Otokuni-gun.

April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Muko-machi, Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura, Kaiinji-mura, Yodo-mura, Koga-mura, Hazukashi-mura, Oe-mura, Oharano-mura, Kuze-mura and Oyamazaki-mura were established in Otokuni-gun.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and ten villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and ten villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and ten villages.

sen.j: 1936年（昭和11年）2月11日 - 淀村が久世郡淀町（1957年（昭和32年）に京都市伏見区に編入）に編入。
sen.e: February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun absorbed Yodo-mura (in 1957, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Yodo-cho).
February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun absorbed Yodo-mura (in 1957, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Yodo-cho).
February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho, Kuse-gun absorbed Yodo-mura (in 1957, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Yodo-cho).
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and nine villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and nine villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of one town and nine villages.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）7月1日 - 京都市に愛宕郡・葛野郡・乙訓郡を管轄する北山城地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: July 1, 1942: Kita-yamashiro local office was set up in Kyoto City to administer Otagi-gun, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun.
July 1, 1942: Kita-yamashiro local office was set up in Kyoto City to administer Otagi-gun, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun.
July 1, 1942: Kita-yamashiro local office was set up in Kyoto City to administer Otagi-gun, Kadono-gun and Otokuni-gun.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）10月1日 - 乙訓村・新神足村・海印寺村が合併し、長岡町が発足。
sen.e: October 1, 1949: Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura and Kaiinji-mura were merged to form Nagaoka-cho.
October 1, 1949: Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura and Kaiinji-mura were merged to form Nagaoka-cho.
October 1, 1949: Otokuni-mura, Shinkotari-mura and Kaiinji-mura were merged to form Nagaoka-cho.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and six villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and six villages.
Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and six villages.
December 1, 1950: Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and three villages.
December 1, 1950: Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and three villages.
December 1, 1950: Otokuni-gun was comprised of two towns and three villages.

sen.j: 久我村・羽束師村が京都市伏見区に編入。
sen.e: Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Koga-mura and Hazukashi-mura.
Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Koga-mura and Hazukashi-mura.

sen.j: 大枝村が京都市右京区に編入。

sen.j: 久世村が京都市南区に編入。

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）11月3日 - 大山崎村が町制施行し大山崎町となる。
sen.e: November 3, 1967: By implementing the chosei (grant of township), Oyamazaki-mura became Oyamazaki-cho.

sen.j: 向日町が市制施行し、向日市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: By implementing the shisei (grant of city status), Muko-machi became Muko City and was separated from the gun (district) system.
By implementing the shisei (grant of city status), Muko-machi became Muko City and was separated from the gun (district) system.
By implementing the shisei (grant of city status), Muko-machi became Muko City and was separated from the gun (district) system.

sen.j: 長岡町が市制施行・改称し、長岡京市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: By implementing the shisei and changing its name, Nagaoka-cho became Nagaokakyo City and was separated from the gun system.
By implementing the shisei and changing its name, Nagaoka-cho became Nagaokakyo City and was separated from the gun system.
